text-document.title: Application ada-2-fhir-r4 format reference
text-document.para: This documents the XML format for the public YATC ada-2-fhir-r4 component's data file in YATC-public/ada-2-fhir-r4/data/ada-2-fhir-r4-data.xml, as used by the ada-2-fhir-r4 command.

entry.para: There are two schemas for this document. For full validation both should be applied:
All elements must be in the https://nictiz.nl/ns/YATC-public namespace.
In some places XInclude processing is allowed, using xi:include elements. The resulting document (after all XIncludes are dereferenced) must be valid.
References to YATC parameters, in text or attribute values (using either ${parname} or {$parname}), will expand. A referenced parameter must exist.

element.name: xi:include
element.para: Reference to a file to include.

section.title: The application element
section.para: The application element defines the processing to be performed for a single application/version combination.
The copied and processed/created documents will be stored underneath {$ada2wikiBaseStorageDirectory}/{@name}/{@version} (parameter defined in YATC-public/ada-2-fhir-r4/data/parameters.xml).

attribute.name: name
attribute.para: The name of the application. For instance: lab.

attribute.name: version
attribute.para: The version of the application. For instance: 4.0.0.

attribute.name: source-project-name
attribute.para: The name of the project (directory) to be used.

attribute.name: source-adarefs2ada
attribute.para: Whether the source documents for setup come from adarefs2ada computations or straight from the ART-DECOR data. See below.

element.name: message
element.para: Message which will be output on the console during processing for this application.

element.name: setup
element.para: Any setup (data copying) to be done.

element.name: action
element.para: Definition of the builds to be performed for a specific action

section.para: Some applications take their input source from data directly retrieved from ART-DECOR and some from adarefs2ada post-processing (all done by the YATC-shared/get-production-ada-instances component). The @source-adarefs2ada attribute takes care of this:

entry.para: source-adarefs2ada="false": The source documents are supposed to come straight from ART-DECOR. They're taken from {$productionAdaInstancesBaseStorageDirectory}/{@name}/{@version}/{$productionAdaInstancesDataSubdir} (parameters defined in YATC-shared/data/parameters.xml).

source-adarefs2ada="true": The source documents are supposed to come from adarefs2ada post-processing. They're taken from the appropriate subdirectories of {$adarefs2adaBaseStorageDirectory}/{@name}/{@version}/{@usecase} (parameter defined in YATC-shared/data/parameters.xml).

section.title: The action element
section.para: The action element defines all the build steps to be performed for a single action, usually based upon the documents copied in the setup element(s).

attribute.name: description
attribute.para: An optional short description for this action. Used in reporting/messaging.

attribute.name: default
attribute.para: Whether this is the default action for this application/version. Only one action can be designated as default.

attribute.name: depends-on
attribute.para: An optional whitespace separated list of identifiers of the actions this action depends on. All actions listed here will be performed before this one.

element.name: message
element.para: Message which will be output on the console during processing for this application.

element.name: build
element.para: Specification of a build step (XSLT transformation).

element.name: validate-with-schema
element.para: Specification of a validation step using a W3C XML Schema

element.name: validate-with-schematron
element.para: Specification of a validation step using a Schematron Schema

element.name: copy
element.para: Specification of a straight file copy step.
